properties.name: bold
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Make the first paragraph in the document bold

properties.name: boldBidirectional
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply bold formatting to bidirectional text (such as Arabic or Hebrew) in the selected range

properties.name: bookmarks
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get all bookmarks within the selected range and display their names in the console

properties.name: borders
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set all borders of the selected range to be visible with a red color and double line style

properties.name: case
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Change all text in the first paragraph to uppercase

properties.name: characterWidth
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the character width of selected text to full-width characters (commonly used for Asian typography)

properties.name: combineCharacters
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the selected text has combined characters formatting and display the result in the console

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of content control objects in the range.

examples.description: Find all content controls in the current selection and highlight them with yellow background color.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a Range object to load and read its text property

properties.name: disableCharacterSpaceGrid
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Disable the character space grid for the selected text range to prevent automatic character spacing adjustments

properties.name: emphasisMark
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply an emphasis mark with a solid circle above the selected text in the document

properties.name: end
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the end position of the first paragraph in the document and insert text at that location

properties.name: endnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of endnotes in the range.

examples.description: Get all endnotes in the selected range and display their reference numbers and text content in the console.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Gets the collection of field objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all fields in the document body and display their types and codes in the console

properties.name: fitTextWidth
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the fit text width to 200 points for the selected text range to compress or expand the text to fit within that width

properties.name: font
properties.description: Gets the text format of the range. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.

examples.description: Set the font name to "Arial", size to 14, and color to blue for the first paragraph in the document.

properties.name: footnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of footnotes in the range.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the count of footnotes within the currently selected range of the document.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get all frames from the selected range and log their count to the console

properties.name: grammarChecked
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Disable grammar checking for a selected range of text in the document

properties.name: hasNoProofing
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the selected text range has the "no proofing" setting enabled and display the result

properties.name: highlightColorIndex
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Highlight the selected text in yellow to emphasize important content in the document

properties.name: horizontalInVertical
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the horizontal-in-vertical text layout to fit characters within the line for the selected range

properties.name: hyperlink
properties.description: Gets the first hyperlink in the range, or sets a hyperlink on the range. All hyperlinks in the range are deleted when you set a new hyperlink on the range. Use a '#' to separate the address part from the optional location part.

examples.description: Set a hyperlink on the selected text that links to "https://www.contoso.com" with a bookmark location "section2"

properties.name: hyperlinks
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get all hyperlinks in the selected range and display their URLs in the console

properties.name: id
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get and display the unique identifier of the first paragraph in the document for tracking purposes

properties.name: inlinePictures
properties.description: Gets the collection of inline picture objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all inline pictures in the selected range and set their width to 150 pixels

properties.name: isEmpty
properties.description: Checks whether the range length is zero.

examples.description: Check if a selected range is empty and display an appropriate message to the user

properties.name: isEndOfRowMark
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the current range is at the end of a table row and display an alert with the result

properties.name: isTextVisibleOnScreen
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the selected text is currently visible on the screen and display an alert with the result

properties.name: italic
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Make the text in the first paragraph italic

properties.name: italicBidirectional
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set bidirectional italic formatting on the selected text range in the document

properties.name: kana
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the kana property of selected text to Hiragana to specify how Japanese phonetic characters should be displayed

properties.name: languageDetected
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the language of the selected text range has been automatically detected and display the result

properties.name: languageId
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the language of the selected text to French

properties.name: languageIdFarEast
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the Far East language formatting to Japanese for the selected text range in a Word document

properties.name: languageIdOther
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the language ID for non-Latin text in the selected range to Japanese

properties.name: listFormat
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the list formatting information from the selected text range and display whether it's part of a numbered or bulleted list

properties.name: lists
properties.description: Gets the collection of list objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all lists in the document body and log the count of lists found

properties.name: pages
properties.description: Gets the collection of pages in the range.

examples.description: Get the number of pages in the current document's body range and display it in the console.

properties.name: paragraphs
properties.description: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all paragraphs in the selected range and highlight each paragraph with yellow color

properties.name: parentBody
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the range.

examples.description: Get the text content of the entire body that contains a selected range of text

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the currently supported content control that contains the range. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if there isn't a parent content control.

examples.description: Toggle the checked state of a checkbox content control in the current selection or its parent content control.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the currently supported content control that contains the range. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if a selected range is inside a content control and highlight the content control's title if it exists.

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the range. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if it isn't contained in a table.

examples.description: Get the table containing a selected range and highlight all cells in that table with yellow background color.

properties.name: parentTableCell
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the range. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if it isn't contained in a table cell.

examples.description: Get the table cell containing a selected range and highlight it with a yellow background color.

properties.name: parentTableCellOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the range. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if the selected range is inside a table cell and highlight the cell yellow if it is, otherwise show a message that the selection is not in a table.

properties.name: parentTableOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the range. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Check if the selected range is inside a table, and if so, highlight the entire parent table with a yellow background color.

properties.name: sections
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get all sections within a selected range and display the count of sections found

properties.name: shading
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply yellow background shading to the selected text range in the document

properties.name: shapes
properties.description: Gets the collection of shape objects anchored in the range, including both inline and floating shapes. Currently, only the following shapes are supported: text boxes, geometric shapes, groups, pictures, and canvases.

examples.description: Get all shapes anchored in the selected range and log their count and types to the console.

properties.name: showAll
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Show all formatting marks (such as spaces, tabs, and paragraph marks) in the selected text range to make document structure visible

properties.name: spellingChecked
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Mark a range of text as already spell-checked to prevent Word from displaying spelling errors for that content

properties.name: start
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the starting character position of the first paragraph in the document and display it in the console

properties.name: storyLength
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the total number of characters in the story that contains the selected range and display it to the user

properties.name: storyType
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Check if the selected text is in the main document body or in a header/footer, and display the story type to the user.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the style name for the range. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the "styleBuiltIn" property.

examples.description: Apply a custom style named "CustomHeading" to the first paragraph in the document

properties.name: styleBuiltIn
properties.description: Specifies the built-in style name for the range. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the "style" property.

examples.description: Insert a heading with the text "This is a sample Heading 1 Title!!" at the beginning of the document body and apply the built-in Heading 1 style to it.

properties.name: tableColumns
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the count of table columns that intersect with the selected range and display it in the console.

properties.name: tables
properties.description: Gets the collection of table objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all tables in the current selection and highlight the first table by setting its shading color to light yellow.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the range.

examples.description: Read and display the text content from the first paragraph in the document

properties.name: twoLinesInOne
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Format selected text to display as two lines in one with parentheses brackets

properties.name: underline
properties.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply a wavy underline style to the selected text in the document

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the contents of the range object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.

examples.description: Clear the contents of the currently selected text range in the Word document.

methods.name: compareLocationWith
methods.description: Compares this range's location with another range's location.

examples.description: Determine the spatial relationship between the first paragraph and the second paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the range and its content from the document.

examples.description: Delete the currently selected text or content from the Word document.

methods.name: detectLanguage
methods.description: > **Note**: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Detect the language of the selected text in the document and display it in the console

methods.name: expandTo
methods.description: Returns a new range that extends from this range in either direction to cover another range. This range isn't changed. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the two ranges don't have a union.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all complete sentences from the current insertion point to the end of the paragraph.

methods.name: expandToOrNullObject
methods.description: Returns a new range that extends from this range in either direction to cover another range. This range isn't changed. If the two ranges don't have a union, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Expand a selected range to include both the selected text and the first paragraph in the document, or detect if they cannot be combined into a single range.

methods.name: getBookmarks
methods.description: Gets the names all bookmarks in or overlapping the range. A bookmark is hidden if its name starts with the underscore character.

examples.description: Get all visible bookmarks in the selected range and display them in the console

methods.name: getComments
methods.description: Gets comments associated with the range.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all comments associated with the currently selected content in the Word document.

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported content controls in the range.

examples.description: Delete the first checkbox content control found in the current selection or its parent container, warning if no checkbox is selected.

methods.name: getHtml
methods.description: Gets an HTML representation of the range object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use `Range.getOoxml()` and convert the returned XML to HTML.

examples.description: Retrieve the HTML representation of the currently selected text in the Word document and output it to the console.

methods.name: getHyperlinkRanges
methods.description: Gets hyperlink child ranges within the range.

examples.description: Retrieve and log all hyperlinks from the entire document body to the console.

methods.name: getNextTextRange
methods.description: Gets the next text range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if this text range is the last one.

examples.description: Find and highlight the first sentence in the document by getting the text range from the start of the document to the first period.

methods.name: getNextTextRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next text range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks. If this text range is the last one, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Split a paragraph into sentences by finding text ranges separated by periods, and highlight every other sentence in yellow.

methods.name: getOoxml
methods.description: Gets the OOXML representation of the range object.

examples.description: Retrieve the OOXML representation of the currently selected text in the Word document and log it to the console.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Clones the range, or gets the starting or ending point of the range as a new range.

examples.description: Insert a dropdown list content control at the end of the current selection in the document.

methods.name: getReviewedText
methods.description: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.

examples.description: Retrieve and compare the original and current versions of the selected text to show changes made during document review.

methods.name: getTextRanges
methods.description: Gets the text child ranges in the range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all complete sentences from the current insertion point to the end of the paragraph.

methods.name: getTrackedChanges
methods.description: Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the range.

examples.description: Get all tracked changes in the current document selection and display their count and types in the console.

methods.name: highlight
methods.description: Highlights the range temporarily without changing document content. To highlight the text permanently, set the range's Font.HighlightColor.

examples.description: Temporarily highlight all occurrences of the word "important" in the document to draw attention during review

methods.name: insertBookmark
methods.description: Inserts a bookmark on the range. If a bookmark of the same name exists somewhere, it is deleted first.

examples.description: Insert a bookmark named "ImportantSection" at the currently selected text range in the document

methods.name: insertBreak
methods.description: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.

examples.description: Insert a page break immediately after the currently selected text in the document.

methods.name: insertCanvas
methods.description: Inserts a floating canvas in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the range.

examples.description: Insert a floating canvas with a rectangle shape at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document.

methods.name: insertComment
methods.description: Insert a comment on the range.

examples.description: Add a comment with user-provided text to the currently selected content in the Word document.

methods.name: insertContentControl
methods.description: Wraps the Range object with a content control.

examples.description: Find all instances of "Contractor" in the document, make them bold, wrap each in a content control with tag "customer" and a numbered title, but only if these content controls don't already exist.

methods.name: insertEndnote
methods.description: Inserts an endnote. The endnote reference is placed after the range.

examples.description: Insert an endnote at the end of the first paragraph with reference text "See additional notes in appendix"

methods.name: insertField
methods.description: Inserts a field at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a date field with custom formatting before the current selection and display its code and result in the console.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a base64-encoded .docx file at the beginning of the currently selected range in the document.

methods.name: insertFootnote
methods.description: Inserts a footnote. The footnote reference is placed after the range.

examples.description: Insert a footnote with specified text at the currently selected content in the document.

methods.name: insertGeometricShape
methods.description: Inserts a geometric shape in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the range.

examples.description: Insert a blue rectangle shape at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.description: Inserts HTML at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert bold HTML text at the beginning of the currently selected range in the document.

methods.name: insertInlinePictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a picture at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert an inline picture from Base64-encoded image data at the start of the first text box in the document.

methods.name: insertOoxml
methods.description: Inserts OOXML at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert formatted text with custom font size, color, line spacing, and paragraph spacing at the beginning of the current selection using OOXML.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a new paragraph with specified content immediately after the current text selection in the document.

methods.name: insertPictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a floating picture in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the range.

examples.description: Insert a floating company logo image at the beginning of the selected text range

methods.name: insertTable
methods.description: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.

examples.description: Insert a 3x4 table with sample data at the end of the selected range

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert the text "New text inserted into the range." at the end of the currently selected range in the document.

methods.name: insertTextBox
methods.description: Inserts a floating text box in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the range.

examples.description: Insert a text box with placeholder text at the beginning of the current selection with specified dimensions and position.

methods.name: intersectWith
methods.description: Returns a new range as the intersection of this range with another range. This range isn't changed. Throws an `ItemNotFound` error if the two ranges aren't overlapped or adjacent.

examples.description: Find and highlight the overlapping text between the first paragraph and the second paragraph in the document.

methods.name: intersectWithOrNullObject
methods.description: Returns a new range as the intersection of this range with another range. This range isn't changed. If the two ranges aren't overlapped or adjacent, then this method will return an object with its `isNullObject` property set to `true`. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

examples.description: Find and highlight the overlapping text between the first paragraph and the second paragraph in the document, or show a message if they don't overlap.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call `context.sync()` before reading the properties.

examples.description: Get and display the text content of the currently selected range in a Word document

methods.name: removeHighlight
methods.description: Removes the highlight added by the Highlight function if any.

examples.description: Remove highlighting from all highlighted text in the first paragraph of the document

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the range object. The search results are a collection of range objects.

examples.description: Find all occurrences of the word "TODO" in a selected range and highlight them in yellow

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects and navigates the Word UI to the range.

examples.description: Insert HTML text at the beginning of the current selection and select the inserted content.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Set multiple formatting properties on the first paragraph's range at once, including font color, size, and bold styling.

methods.name: split
methods.description: Splits the range into child ranges by using delimiters.

examples.description: Split a text range containing comma-separated values into individual ranges and highlight each segment with alternating colors

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript `toJSON()` method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to `JSON.stringify()`. (`JSON.stringify`, in turn, calls the `toJSON` method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original `Word.Range` object is an API object, the `toJSON` method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as `Word.Interfaces.RangeData`) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a range object to JSON format to log or store its properties after loading specific properties like text and font name.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across `.sync` calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Get a range from the current selection, track it across multiple sync calls, and apply formatting changes while maintaining the reference to the same range object.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call `context.sync()` before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Search for text in a document, highlight all instances, then untrack the range objects to free memory after processing.
